str2: First, in the first place, before, formerly. Neuter of protos as adverb; firstly.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: A prolonged form of a primary verb; to 'know' in a great variety of applications and with many implications.
Neuter of hostis as conjunction; demonstrative, that; causative, because.
On, to, against, on the basis of, at.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Last, at the last, finally, till the end. A superlative probably from echo; farthest, final.
A day, the period from sunrise to sunset.
A mocker, scoffer. From empaizo; a derider, i.e. a false teacher.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Middle - 3rd Person Plural

str2: Mockery, scoffing, scorn. From empaizo; derision.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Nominative Masculine Plural
Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
Pertaining to self, i.e. One's own; by implication, private or separate.
Desire, eagerness for, inordinate desire, lust. From epithumeo; a longing.
